title: How do people play anything but tank supports?
body:
I main Thresh, Leona and Braum. People keep telling me that I need to start playing Janna because she's so strong right now. I've tried to learn Janna twice now and I just don't get her at all.

She has the worst play making ability out of all the supports, I hardly ever catch someone out and made a good pick as Janna.
She's really squishy and struggles against snowballing champs. Not to mention in Bronze my team comp always seems to be lacking a tank, forcing me to pick tank support.
She has really good peel and can deny engages, I see the potential in it, but most of the time my ADC doesn't know how to use my peel effectively.

Can someone explain why Janna is better than say, Braum? Braum has slightly less peel, but insane level 1, with snowball potential and can lock down high priority targets. He's also really tanky and isn't there to help that fed Katarina get another reset like Janna.

TL;DR
Why do people pick Janna? Aren't tank supports just generally better, especially for solo queue.

replies.body: Janna is very good at protecting her team and peeling for her ADC. Janna is mainly classified as a disengage support which means she is better at preventing and spliting up fights rather than starting them. Janna's kit rewards more passive play in the early game by protecting the duo lane with shields and preventing fights with her knock up and slow. Janna works best with late game carries, such as jinx & kogmaw, because she can protect them in the early/mid game while also giving them a big attack damage buff on shield in the late game. The reason why you aren't doing so well as janna is because you aren't playing her to her strengths. So instead of trying to make picks you should be aiming to make plays in team fights by protecting you damage dealers and preventing the enemy team from engaging on your team

I kind of see what you mean, but how do I get my ADC fed in the first place so he's worth protecting? If I can't make picks, it's really hard to get ADC fed. I guess he could be strong from CS but Blitzcrank, Morgana and stuff just zone me so bad early game.

Okay I see, the main way that you will getting you carry fed is from punishing the aggression from the enemy team with your abilities, the tornado is the main ability for punishing and disengaging as the knock up lasts forever. Also the reason why I said that late game carries work well is because if you are protecting them and letting them free farm then they will just scale better than other adcs. So early game your main focus should be onletting your carry farm, mid game game try get some map objectives with your ADC or just group, team fight and protect your ADC letting them get gold and possibly kills. Also your point about blitz and morg is also a valid point. Janna doesn't do too well against poke or zone heavy lanes. So if you get into a situation like this basically just play safe, shield as much damage as possible while trying to keep up with the opponent.

TL:DR
Janna should try to passively lane
Then she can start getting getting her ADC fed in team fights where janna succeeds very well

Okay, here is what I learnt not so long ago.

There are two different classifications that I give to a support; How tanky they are and what they do to help the ADC.

For example, I found Alistar to be a Tanky Peeler. He keeps the enemies off of his ADC, but he doesn't exactly fair well when going aggressive against most other champs.

On the other hand, Morgana is a squishy poker. Her Q W combo deals a lot of damage to enemies, while her Q alone offers quite a long CC duration giving her ADC the chance to layeth the smakethdown (score a kill)

Janna would be a squishy peeler, keeping the enemies away from her ADC. Peelers generally enjoy passive lanes and just sitting back and throwing the general nado/headbutt/other form of GTFO to the enemy.  Keep your ADC alive and save them from the predicaments that they seem to always find themselves in.

Janna is good at getting out of bad situations/saving your team from bad situations, which happens pretty often, and also good at cockblocking fed assassins and bruisers who are often the ones carrying games in solo queue. Makes it so you can just escape from all the bad fights until your team manages to get into a good fight.

I can still make aggressive plays with Janna but then again I play her as a walking Gragas ult and use her ult to isolate an out of position enemy.

Thats pretty much all I do in teamfights.

Janna is by far the best support you could ask for, She IS played differently than a tank, but is still my top tier support, above leona and braum.

Work on using her AS A SUPPORT, Not a tank. 
Don't get up in their faces unless you need to peel, Just sit back and Disengage and SUPPORT your adc with shields/slows.

>Why do people pick Janna? Aren't tank supports just generally better, especially for solo queue.

Tank supports are play making supports so yes they are very much better for solo queue, Janna is what you pick as a peel/utility support, the only play making she has is her ult to split the enemies up.

There's 3 kinds of supports;
Utility supports: Janna, Soraka, Lulu etc.
Play making supports: Leona, Thresh, Braum
Damage supports: Annie, Lux, Zyra

The best for solo queue are either the play making or the damage supports, utility supports mostly need someone fed or they are just going to be pretty useless.

EDIT: Example of a janna game going well
http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/89151027/200474676

Got lucian fed, then i started roaming and assisting jungle.

It's a diametrically opposite kind of support. With Leona, you're going in, staying there, and making sure half of their team sits down and shuts up while yours does the work. With Janna, you're making sure the Leona gets to do none of that.

Personally, i can do both, but whenever someone asks me to play support Zyra or anything like that i'm... like... no way in hell.

Janna is about keeping you AD alive for a VERY VERY long time. Everything about her lets her peel the enemy off the AD so they can keep doing damage. She isn't necessarily a playmaker, and she requires an AD that knows to trust you and keep fighting. So no, don't pick Janna in bronze unless you are duo with your ADC.

In a tank meta where all tanks want to do is sit on your ADC's face, Janna is really strong.

Janna has the 2nd highest winrate for supports just after Leona.

Well, there are supports who have the ability to make plays and there are supports who's supposed to negate those plays. Those tankie supports like leona, braum, blitz, taric, etc. have power in terms of engage and making plays, but that doesn't mean those like janna, sona, lulu, nami, etc. can't either.

I play all those utility supports and i never used those tankie supports competitively. I like peeling for my team mates and predicting enemy's movement from a far. But I still have a watchful eye for those tankie supports because there's power in them. When I was back in Gold, people used to abuse my pick like "dont pick nami, pick blitzcrank"; just ignore those people and play what you're comfortable with. If you're forced to play Janna and you don't want to, you'll probably not reach to the expectation of those people and having a miserable time playing her, too.
